One of the most well-documented concerns is dental fluorosis, which is the mottling and discoloration of tooth enamel. Modern science clearly shows that the risks outweigh any potential dental benefits, especially when there are safer, more targeted alternatives available, such as fluoride toothpaste and professional dental treatments.

So, no—fluoride in drinking water is not safe for people to consume. It's a toxic substance that is being added to a public resource in a way that lacks informed consent and disproportionately affects the most vulnerable members of our society.
